title: Drawing, Design for ceiling decoration
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. The scheme is that of horizontal bands below an ovoidal vault, with an ovoidal pole in the center between arches above. Somewhat more than one quarter is shown. A putto is shown in the wedge left from teh pointed arch and the ruined painting. In the center is a deepened spherical quadrangle with a seated figure. The band is decorated with an octagonal representation between plant palmettes. Pairs of figures, seated upon the base of the cetnral vault, are suggested for the centers of the long sides, facing the corners of the room.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for ceiling decoration. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1563
